meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, the emergency response team had to remobilize to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were ordered to remobilize quickly after receiving new orders from their commander.
meanings.sent3: The superhero had to remobilize their powers to defeat the villain once and for all.
meanings.sent4: The town had to remobilize its resources to recover from the unexpected disaster.
meanings.sent5: In order to win the game, the team needed to remobilize their strategy for the final round.

meanings.definition: To put back into motion or action
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to remobilize the broken engine to get the car running again.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to remobilize the students after the lunch break to continue the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat needed some extra treats to remobilize and start playing with its toys.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to remobilize the team's motivation after a tough loss in the previous game.
meanings.sent5: The conductor had to remobilize the orchestra for the final performance of the season.
